subSubSection.paragraph: Arthrinium descalsii Pintos & P. Alvarado sp. nov. Fig. 6
Named to honor the eminent mycologist Enric Descals Callisen.

Sexual morph: Stromata forming black fusiform spots that merge with each other with age, forming an erumpent black mass visible at the naked eye, 2-10 x 0.2-0.5 mm in size, with the long axis broken at the top revealing the ostioles of pseudothecia. Ascomata pseudothecia, subglobose with a flattened base, arranged in rows, brown to dark brown, 150-220 μm high x 150-250 μm wide (n = 20). Peridium with several layers of cells arranged in textura angularis, with a conspicuous ostiole 50-80 μm in diameter, periphysate. Hamathecium paraphyses hyphae-like, septate, hyaline. Asci cylindrical, clavate, with a short or indistinct pedicel, with rounded apices, measuring (73 -)82-95(- 111) x (16 -)17-20(- 23) μm (n = 30). Ascospores uniseriate to biseriate, hyaline, smooth-walled, apiosporic, composed of a large curved upper cell and smaller lower cell, fusiform to slightly curved in shape with narrowly rounded ends, guttulated, sometimes with a thick gelatinous sheath, (17 -)18-22(- 24) x (6 -)7-9(- 10) μm , and a basal cell 3-5 μm (n = 45). Asexual morph: Mycelium hyaline, septate, branched, hyphae 1.5-4.5 μm in diameter Conidiophores reduced to the conidiogenous cells. Conidiogenous cells solitary on hyphae, ampuliform, hyaline to brown, 5 x 4 μm . Conidia brown, smooth, guttulate, globose to ellipsoid (5 -)7(- 8) µm long (n = 20) in face view, lenticular with a paler equatorial slit and 6-7 μm long in side view (n = 10). Sterile cells elongated, sometimes mixed among conidia. Culture characteristics: ascospores germinating on MEA 2% within 24-48 h. Colonies flat, spreading, with sparse aerial mycelium, pale siena.

Arthrinium descalsii is closely related with A. phragmitis and A. balearicum . It was found in the Mediterranean grass Ampelodesmos mauritanicus , although additional samples are needed before concluding if it could be exclusively associated with this endemic host. Ascospore size is often smaller than that of A. balearicum , (23 -)26-30(- 32) x (7 -)9-10(- 12) µm , but it matches that reported in the protologue of A. phragmitis , (20 -)22-24(- 25) x (7 -)8-9(- 10) µm . However, the conidiophores of A. descalsii are reduced to conidiogenous cells, while those of A. phragmitis measure about 10-45 x 1.5-2 µm , and conidia are slightly smaller in face view, measuring (5 -)7(- 8) µm long in A. descalsii and up to 8 -10(- 11) µm in A. phragmitis .
Spain: Balearic Islands: Mallorca, es Capdella, on dead stems of Ampelodesmos mauritanicus , 31 Jan. 2018, A. Pintos (MA-Fungi 91724 holotype, AP31118A isotype, CBS 145130 ex-type culture).
